question.text: The property not shown by the "amphibians of the plant kingdom" is

options.text: The plant body is thallus like, attached to substratum by help of rhizoids
The antherozoids are released in water for fertilization
Zygote formed undergoes meiotic division immediately
They have leaf like, stem like and root like structures

solution.text: Bryophytes (amphibians of the plant kingdom) are plants that can live on soil but are dependent on water for fertilization. The plant body of bryophytes is thallus like and attached to the substratum by unicellular or multicellular rhizoids.  The male gametes produce antherozoids which are released in the water to come in contact with archegonium and form a zygote which does not undergo reduction immediately.  It undergoes mitosis to form sporophyte which is attached to the gametophyte
